posts.post_content: This is... a damn fine pinger, at common no less. I had one in my pre-release pool for Izzet and it carried all of my games. Make sure to remember and ping your opponent *before* casting any multi-color spell. It can be hard to remember even sober ;)

posts.post_content:
This would have been a very cool card if just it were a regular pinger like [Prodigal Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prodigal Pyromancer).  
  
It would have been the [Cinder Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cinder Pyromancer) of this set.  
I think having three more toughness than him wouldn't have been a problem either, since casting multicolored spells is by far not as easy than red spells in a monored deck (duh!)  
  
  
"*[Quietus Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quietus Spike) in multiplayer.*"  
@matteumayo As a creature with zero power and *Defender*, this would be one of the worst choices to equip Quietus Spike to - look closely at what the card says: "*combat* damage". That means it'll only trigger from damage that the equipped creature causes with its power in combat by attacking (or blocking).  
If Quietus Spike triggered with regular damage, these Goblins would in fact be a cruel choice in multiplayer - but their activated ability doesn't count as combat damage, and since even death touch won't help them when blocking, you're better off... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This would have been a very cool card if just it were a regular pinger like Prodigal Pyromancer.

It would have been the Cinder Pyromancer of this set.
I think having three more toughness than him wouldn't have been a problem either, since casting multicolored spells is by far not as easy than red spells in a monored deck (duh!)


"Quietus Spike in multiplayer."
@matteumayo As a creature with zero power and Defender, this would be one of the worst choices to equip Quietus Spike to - look closely at what the card says: "combat damage". That means it'll only trigger from damage that the equipped creature causes with its power in combat by attacking (or blocking).
If Quietus Spike triggered with regular damage, these Goblins would in fact be a cruel choice in multiplayer - but their activated ability doesn't count as combat damage, and since even death touch won't help them when blocking, you're better off... (see all)

posts.post_content: Definitely a card that teaches new players the most optimal times to activate effects...in response to removal, end of opponent's turn, immediately after declaring blocks on a creature that would kill it during combat. Synergy with [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) is pure gravy.
posts.html:
Definitely a card that teaches new players the most optimal times to activate effects...in response to removal, end of opponent's turn, immediately after declaring blocks on a creature that would kill it during combat. Synergy with Krenko, Mob Boss is pure gravy.

Posted By: Battleguild (9/26/2012 6:48:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
DO NOT BE FOOLED! This card will mess you up. Every game I went up against these guys at the prerelease I either wasted spells trying to get rid of them or I ignored them and took so much extra damage.... I might've won an individual game from a round but I didn't win a round when this guy was in my opponents deck. Getting rid of a 4 body is tough without help from the other sets.
  
   
Were talking 2-4 damage some turns. One time I had 7 life left. He had 2 life left and a stab wound on his lobber crew. This is how his final turn went...
  
   
Tap lobber crew, deal 1 dmg
  
Cast izzet charm, draw 2/discard 2
  
untap lobber crew, tap for 1 dmg.
  
He drew [hypersonic dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hypersonic dragon) via izzet charm.
  
Cast dragon, untap lobber crew.
  
Swing for 4 dmg with dragon. Lobber crew for 1 and the win.
  
   
I died a little inside. And for all my lobber crew pair ups I didn't pull a single one myself. Zzz...
  
   
Play this card if you're smart. Ignore it if you're not. But it can and will win games r... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Swing for 4 dmg with dragon. Lobber crew for 1 and the win.

I died a little inside. And for all my lobber crew pair ups I didn't pull a single one myself. Zzz...
